availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton Jameson Durham (Boyle County, Ky, attorney (& circuit court judge? see Google folder note))

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Martha J. Durham. Father of Lewis H. Durham, Ben J. Durham, James W. Durham, and Orna M. Durham. Graduate of Asbury University in Greencastle, Indiana, in 1844. Studied law with Joshua F. Bell. Graduate of Louisville Law School in 1850. Attorney in Boyle County in 1850. Attorney in Boyle County in 1860. Attorney in Danville, Kentucky, from 1862 to 1873.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 383B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 842.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 158A.
James Grant Wilson & John Fiske, eds., Appleton's Cyclopedia of American Biography, Vol. 2: Crane-Grimshaw (New York: D. Appleton & Company, 1887), 272.
"Milton Jameson Durham (1824-1911)," Find A Grave, Memorial #15723178, accessed September 11, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15723178.
